sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A maske presented at Ludlow Castle, 1634 on Michaelmasse night, before the Right Honorable, Iohn Earle of Bridgewater, Vicount Brackly, Lord Præsident of Wales, and one of His Maiesties most honorable Privie Counsell. Comus Milton, John, 1608-1674. Lawes, Henry, 1596-1662.
[4], 35, [1] p.
Printed [by Augustine Mathewes] for Humphrey Robinson, at the signe of the Three Pidgeons in Pauls Church-yard, London : 1637.
The first edition of "Comus" by John Milton. Editor's dedication signed: H. Lavves. Printer's name from STC. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======

[4], 35, [1] p.
Printed [by Augustine Mathewes] for Humphrey Robinson, at the signe of the Three Pidgeons in Pauls Church-yard, London : 1637.
The first edition of "Comus" by John Milton. Editor's dedication signed: H. Lavves. Printer's name from STC. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.

the signe of the Three Pidgeons in Pauls Church-yard
